# Manage Team Members

With team management, you invite colleagues to your organization, assign roles, and keep track of all members. Depending on your subscription plan, you have different numbers of team seats available.

## Prerequisites

- You need the **Owner role** to invite and manage team members
- Your subscription plan must have available team seats:
  - **STARTER:** 1 user (only you)
  - **BUSINESS:** 3 users
  - **AGENTUR:** 10 users (+ additional for a fee)

## Team Page Overview

Under **Settings â†’ Team** you'll find three important statistics:

### 1. Active Members

Shows you how many of your available team seats are occupied. When you reach the limit, you must either upgrade your subscription or remove a member before inviting new ones.

[Screenshot: Team statistics with seat limit]

### 2. Pending Invitations

Here you can see how many invitations have been sent but not yet accepted. Invitations are valid for 7 days.

### 3. Role Distribution

Shows you at a glance how many Owners and Members are in your team.

---

## Invite Team Member

### Step 1: Open Invitation Dialog

1. Go to **Settings â†’ Team**
2. Click **Invite Member** in the top right
3. If the button is grayed out, you've reached your team limit

[Screenshot: "Invite Member" button]

### Step 2: Enter Email Address

1. Enter the new member's email address
2. The role is automatically set to **Member** (default)
3. Click **Send Invitation**

[Screenshot: Invitation dialog]

### Step 3: Invitation Email

The new member automatically receives an email with:

- A personal invitation link
- Information about the assigned role
- Information about who sent the invitation

**Important:** The invitation link is valid for 7 days. After that, you need to resend the invitation.

> **Tip:** The invited member doesn't need to register with CeleroPress in advance. They can sign up directly via the invitation link using any auth method (Google, Email/Password).

---

## Roles and Permissions

CeleroPress has two main roles:

### Owner

- **Full control** over the entire organization
- Can invite and remove team members
- Can change roles and transfer ownership
- Manages billing and subscription
- Can change organization settings (branding, email, domain)
- **Cannot be removed** (only through ownership transfer)

### Member

- **Normal access** to all work areas
- Can create and edit projects, contacts, media
- Cannot manage team members
- Cannot change billing or organization settings
- Ideal for colleagues working operationally

> **Note:** There is always exactly **one Owner** per organization. If you want to transfer ownership, you'll automatically be demoted to Member.

---

## Change a Member's Role

### From Member to Owner (Transfer Ownership)

1. Find the member in the list
2. Open the dropdown in the **Role** column
3. Select **Make Owner**
4. **Important warning:** You'll become a Member yourself!
5. Confirm the transfer

[Screenshot: Ownership transfer dialog with warning]

**What happens:**

- The selected member becomes Owner
- You automatically become Member
- You lose access to team management and billing
- The change can only be reversed by the new Owner

> **Important:** Think carefully about who you transfer ownership to. This person will then have full control over the organization!

---

## Resend Invitation

If a member didn't receive the invitation email or the link has expired:

1. Find the member with **Invited** status in the list
2. Click the **three-dot menu** (â‹®) on the right
3. Select **Resend Invitation**
4. A new email with a fresh link will be sent

[Screenshot: Member with "Invited" status and three-dot menu]

> **Tip:** The new link is valid for another 7 days. The old link becomes invalid.

---

## Remove Team Member

### Delete Invitation (not yet accepted)

1. Find the member with **Invited** status
2. Click the **three-dot menu** (â‹®)
3. Select **Delete Invitation**
4. Confirm deletion

**What happens:**

- The invitation is deleted
- The invitation link becomes invalid
- The team seat becomes available again

### Remove Active Member

1. Find the member with **Active** status
2. Click the **three-dot menu** (â‹®)
3. Select **Remove Member**
4. **Important warning:** The member loses access immediately!
5. Confirm removal

[Screenshot: Confirmation dialog with warning]

**What happens:**

- The member is immediately set to **Inactive**
- They lose access to the organization
- On next login, they're redirected to the account page
- Content created by this member remains
- The team seat becomes available again

> **Important:** The Owner cannot be removed. To remove an Owner, ownership must first be transferred.

---

## Status Overview

Each member has a status displayed in the list:

### ðŸŸ¡ Invited

- Invitation was sent
- Link not yet clicked or expired
- Shows the invitation date

### ðŸŸ¢ Active

- Member accepted the invitation
- Has full access (depending on role)
- Shows the last activity date

### ðŸ”´ Inactive

- Member was removed
- No longer has access
- Usually not shown in the list

---

## Frequently Asked Questions

**Can I invite someone directly as Owner?**

No, new members are always invited as Member. After joining, you can transfer ownership.

**What happens when I reach my team limit?**

The "Invite Member" button is disabled. You must either upgrade your subscription or remove a member.

**How many team members can I have?**

- STARTER: 1 (only you)
- BUSINESS: 3
- AGENTUR: 10 (+ additional for â‚¬20/month per person)

**Can I re-invite a removed member?**

Yes, you can simply invite the email address again. The system will automatically reactivate the inactive member.

**Does a Member see the same data as me?**

Yes, Members see all projects, contacts, and media of the organization. They just can't edit team management, billing, or organization settings.

**What happens to data when I remove a member?**

All projects, contacts, and media created by this member remain. The data belongs to the organization, not the user.

---

## Next Steps

- [Roles and Permissions](/support/en/einstellungen/rollen-und-berechtigungen) â€“ Detailed overview of all permissions
- [Invite Team (Onboarding)](/support/en/erste-schritte/team-einladen) â€“ Part of the onboarding process
- [Manage Subscription](/support/en/account/subscription-billing) â€“ Upgrade team limit
